DOC.brief_summary: There is no AED or medication that has been demonstrated to affect the development of post-traumatic epilepsy. Biperiden is a cholinergic antagonist, acting in the muscarinic receptor, that is widely used as an anti Parkinson drug. The investigators data with animal models of epilepsy indicate that anti-muscarinic agents might affect the natural course of the disease in the case of post-traumatic epilepsy.
DOC.brief_title: Use of Biperiden for the Prevention of Post-traumatic Epilepsy
DOC.criteria: between 18 and 75 year of age patients with a diagnosis of severe TBI admitted to an emergency unit within 6 hours of the accident, regardless of the accident brain CT scan with signs of acute intraparenchymatous contusion signed informed consent (possibly by a relative) malignant neoplasia and other severe comorbidities neurodegenerative disorders cerebrovascular accident in the previous 6 months record of convulsive seizures or use of antiepileptic medication pregnancy concomitant use of the other anticholinergic medications presence of any factor that may contraindicate the use of biperiden participation in other clinical trial alcohol intoxication will not lead to exclusion of the subject.
